titlestmt.titleproper: George Ledin, Jr. ALGOL, Vol. 1: A Reference Source Book, 1974. Finding Aid.
titlestmt.author: Prepared by Pat Hennessy.

profiledesc.creation: Text converted and initial EAD tagging provided by Apex Data Services, April 2000; updated by Leslie Czechowski, March 2004.

did.unittitle: George Ledin, Jr. ALGOL, Vol. 1: A Reference Source Book
did.abstract: ALGOL: Volume 1: A Reference Source Book, is the manuscript for the first of a proposed three volume set on the ALGOL programming language which apparently remains unpublished. In this volume, which appears to have been the only completed volume, Ledin presents ALGOL reports, ALGOL variant charts, extensive literature bibliographies, and biographies of 232 prominent ALGOL scholars. Chapters are preceded by an historical overview.
did.repository: University of Minnesota Libraries. Charles Babbage Institute. [cbi]

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: George Ledin, Jr., was a computer science professor at University of San Francisco and Sonoma State University. He co-authored The Programmer's Book of Rules (1979) with Victor Ledin. In 1982 he wrote PASCAL.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: ALGOL, Vol. 1: A Reference Source Book is the manuscript for the first volume in a proposed three volume set on the ALGOL programming language. In this volume, Ledin presents ALGOL reports, ALGOL variant charts, extensive literature bibliographies, and biographies or 232 prominent ALGOL scholars. The chapters are preceded by an historical overview.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the catalog of the University of Minnesota Libraries. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
controlaccess.subject: ALGOL (Computer program language)--History--Sources
Computer programming

title.emph: ALGOL, Vol. 1: A Reference Source Book

acqinfo.head: Acquisition:
acqinfo.p: The manuscript was given to the Charles Babbage Institute by George Ledin, Jr.

accessrestrict.head: Access to materials:
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collection is unrestricted.

userestrict.head: Copyright:
userestrict.p: The author, George Ledin, retains the copyright to the manuscript. Researchers may quote from the collection under the fair use provisions of the copyright law (Title 17, U.S. Code).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: George Ledin, Jr. ALGOL, Vol. 1: A Reference Source Book (CBI 59), Charles Babbage Institute, University of Minnesota, Minneapolis.
